intro: Habenaria rotundiloba, commonly known as the round-lobed orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, often in mountainous regions. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is known for its delicate, fragrant blooms. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some areas.
